title: Windows network drives are not supported (repo realpath breaks every runner CWD, and more)

labels.name: severity-critical
labels.description: makes it unusable, causes data loss, introduces security vulnerability

body:
I have a machine that has the user home "mounted" as a network drive `Z:` that maps to `\\BNBDATALAD\Users\mi, where `BNBDATALAD` is the name of the machine and am working on (i.e. "localhost").

I can

```
Z:
cd TMP
md some
cd some
git init
git annex init
```

with no problems. However I cannot create a dataset with datalad:

```
(base) Z:\TMP>datalad create this
[INFO] Creating a new annex repo at Z:\TMP\this
[INFO] Detected a filesystem without fifo support.
[INFO] Disabling ssh connection caching.
[INFO] Detected a crippled filesystem.
[INFO] git-annex: .git\hooks\: openTempFile: does not exist (No such file or directory)
[INFO] git-annex: init: 1 failed
CommandError: '"git" "annex" "init" "-c" "annex.dotfiles=true"' failed with exitcode 1 under \\BNBDATALAD\Users\mih\TMP\this
```

This smells like a path handling bug. Possibly, git-annex is not executed in `Z:\TMP`.

More evidence in this regard: The runner is not instructed to work under `Z:`

```
(Pdb) p cwd
'\\\\BNBDATALAD\\Users\\mih\\TMP\\this'
```

and the reason for that is that the repo doesn't believe it is under `Z:`

```
(Pdb) p self.path
'\\\\BNBDATALAD\\Users\\mih\\TMP\\this3'
```

I suspect that is an effect of `realpath`'ing the repo location.... Jup:

```
(Pdb) realpath('Z:')
'\\\\BNBDATALAD\\Users\\mih\\TMP'
```

And such a path is not usable in `cmd.exe`:

```
(base) Z:\TMP>cd \\\\BNBDATALAD\\Users\\mih\\TMP
"\\\\BNBDATALAD\\Users\\mih\\TMP"
CMD unterstützt keine UNC-Pfade als aktuelles Verzeichnis.
```

(German for "hell, no!")

Conclusion: no `realpath`'ing on Windows, please.
